entries.meaning: A work, such as a blanket, composed of many different colors and shapes, sewn together to make an interesting whole.
(figurative) Any kind of creation that utilizes many different aspects to create one whole piece.
examples: Bill took all of his poetry and put it together in a folder. It made up a patchwork of his life.

entries.meaning: (derogatory) A state of regulations whose constituents have an opaque scope of application because of their questionable delimitation with regard to each other.

verbs.description: patchwork (third-person singular simple present patchworks, present participle patchworking, simple past and past participle patchworked)

entries.meaning: To create a patchwork from pieces of fabric.
To assemble from a variety of sources; to cobble together.
